mods.abstract: A RUNAWAY IN JAIL. WAS committed into the Prison of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 10th of November instant, a negroman calling himself Ralph or Raphael, and saying he belongs to Mr. Thomas Compton, residing about 5 miles North of Patersonville. This boy is of a griffe color, 5 feet 9 inches high, spare made, and speaking English only. He had in his possession when taken up, a brown poney with saddle and briddle. The owner is request to come forward, prove property, pay charges, and take him away otherwise he will be disposed of according to law. CHS. THOMPSON, Jailor. Opelousas Nov. 19th, 1853.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
